title: Augmented Reality (AR)-Based Project-Based Education for Higher Education STEM Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science theories and experience utilizing digital tools
context.additional_context: Learners develop prototypes using AR technology to solve real scientific problems, collaborating and engaging in self-directed learning in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Virtual simulation models of physical science laboratory equipment can be designed using AR technology
AR-based data visualization and interactive systems can be implemented for STEM problem-solving

In a 1-week intensive PBL (Problem-Based Learning) environment, learners (3–4 per team) develop an AR solution prototype using Unity or Unreal Engine. They achieve ≥70/100 points on a rubric (technical implementation 30%, collaboration 20%, creativity 20%, completeness 30%) after presentation/demonstration. Version control via GitHub/GitLab, ≥2 weekly scrum meetings, and submission of an executable prototype and 10-page report are required.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
